H0.text: Toxins are removed from the bloodstream by the liver is the statement that best describes how the circulatory system and respiratory system can work together.

H1.text: The stomach signals for the production of gastric juices is the statement that best describes how the circulatory system and respiratory system can work together.

H2.text: Food molecules are transported to the organs of the body by the circulatory system and respiratory system working together.

H3.text: Gases are exchanged between the lungs and blood vessels is the statement that best describes how the circulatory system and respiratory system can work together.

A4.text: Gas exchange in the lungs occurs in millions of small air sacs. In mammals and reptiles, these are called alveoli, and in birds, they are known as atria. These microscopic air sacs have a rich blood supply, bringing the air into close contact with the blood.

A5.text: The primary purpose of the respiratory system is the equalizing of the partial pressures of the respiratory gases in the alveolar air with those in the pulmonary capillary blood (Fig. 11).
